etymologies: mid 19th century: from German, from Latin parum ‘little’ + affinis ‘related’ (from its low reactivity)

definitions: a flammable, whitish, translucent, waxy solid consisting of a mixture of saturated hydrocarbons, obtained by distillation from petroleum or shale and used in candles, cosmetics, polishes, and sealing and waterproofing compounds.
shortDefinitions: flammable, whitish, translucent, waxy solid consisting of mixture of saturated hydrocarbons

definitions: a colorless, flammable, oily liquid similarly obtained and used as fuel, especially kerosene.
shortDefinitions: colourless, flammable, oily liquid similarly obtained and used as fuel
